metadata.Title: CVE-2022-29799 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - high.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in networkd-dispatcher. This flaw exists because no functions are sanitized by the OperationalState or the AdministrativeState of networkd-dispatcher. This attack leads to a directory traversal to escape from the “/etc/networkd-dispatcher” base directory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-29799` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

networkd-dispatcher - 2.1-2ubuntu0.22.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: networkd-dispatcher package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1-2ubuntu0.22.04.2').
